channel.title: Im an inexperienced coder
channel.description:
ok before you even read futher, - Im not gonna buy a book - Im not gonna buy anything - Im not gonna pay you for teaching me - Im not gonna pay for anything - I don't want you to spoonfeed me
ok so I experimented around with a few sources, i kinda understand commands etc now but still i don't know how to code. I sorta understand what the code means now (the code I earlier thought was random shit so hey im going forward) And I can use tuts and copy and paste now and know where to add tabs and enters to make things work a bit but further I can't code at all and I want YOU to learn me it! Anyone interested? BTW my webcame broke so i don't have skype atm neither am i English or American.
By the way I have and quite interesting project in mind and I think if i can code that I would know pretty much so if anybody here feels more comfortable teaching me when working on something together I got an interesting idea.

item.title: Im an inexperienced coder
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

^ No. C&P is your fucking worst enemy when writing code. Don’t C&P. Make the windows smaller, and write it how it is, but don’t C&P when learning Java. It’s best to just copy it(like in school when you copy notes), you learn more from writing it yourself. Now obviously you can C&P huge chunks of code only when it’s necessary. An IDE not only help you with errors, but more importantly helps you find variables/methods in this. file or any other file.

Read full topic

item.title: Im an inexperienced coder
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

haha i love your english mines worse anyways best play with the code already written abit learn how to search and alter small things in the code like numbers and strings and remember c&p is your friend also ctrl + F in most cases c&p some code from diffrent commands voids booleans etc… together and fix brackets if you dont know how post your code and im sure someone will help and also ask them to explain understanding can help you rely on yourself instead of others in the future

Read full topic

item.description:

y u yust quoted him for u sig lol? Nice :P[/quote]

cuz it’s damn funny

IDE is a prgramm that helps you finding errors. and coding is easier in an IDE

http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-java-developers/indigosr1

Downloads are on the right side of the website

and use this tutorial for eclipse setup:
http://r u n e - s e r v e r .org/runescape-development/rs2 - server/snippets/289645-set-up-eclipse-use-servers.html

*hope you know what to change in the url

Yes, an IDE helps too. But you should download this highscore.googlecode.com/files/Thinking%20In%20Java%204th.pdf Best book ever

Read full topic

item.title: Im an inexperienced coder
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I learned basic programming from RSPS, self-teaching. However reading through the basics of Java by the people who own Java is going to help you make it a whole lot easier. Of course, the only real way to learn is to apply yourself to what you’re doing and practice making programs.

If it isn’t too difficult, jump into using an IDE right away as well.

You can’t master a programming language and you can’t learn it in a few days. You’ll always be learning something about it.

Read full topic
